definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: These rays reveal God's uncompromising devotion to life.
sentences.chinese: 這些暖流令我們看見神堅毅不屈地熱愛生命。

sentences.english: Relaxation of warmness flow into my left shoulder, and I feel warm and heavy;
sentences.chinese: 輕鬆暖流，流進左肩，感到溫暖沉重。

sentences.english: He felt a familiar warmth inside. This is why he taught.
sentences.chinese: 一股熟悉的暖流湧上他的心頭，這正是他教學的原因。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, as the cooled water sinks, warm currents from the south flow northward to take its place.
sentences.chinese: 冷水下沉時，從南方向北流的暖流則取而代之。

sentences.english: But more recent observations show the currents are stable.
sentences.chinese: 但是最近的觀察則顯示出，暖流仍在繼續。
這時候，真相宛如一股撫慰傷口的暖流沁入心間。

sentences.english: Give north-western Europe bring of warm Atlantic ocean water combines.
sentences.chinese: 給西北歐帶來溫暖的大西洋暖流。

definition: cold air current/cold ocean current/cold stream
(usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
